forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this morning, a veil of cloud cover hangs softly over the area, hinting at the coolness characteristic of this time of year. The temperature, poised at a refreshing 52 degrees, welcomes a subtle southwest breeze that dances gently through the streets, whispering promises of the sun's return. As the day unfolds, the clouds will gradually yield to an embrace of brightness, with the afternoon revealing a charmingly mild high near 66. 

While the fog may linger along the coast, rendering the Golden Gate Bridge an ethereal silhouette, the downtown area is expected to bask in increasing clarity, albeit with the unmistakable touch of that coastal air that keeps summer at bay. With wind gusts carrying the scent of the sea at times reaching 31 mph, it would be wise to dress in layers, perhaps a light sweater alongside your favorite pair of jeans, allowing for comfort in the changing temperatures. For those seeking to unwind, a leisurely stroll through one of the many neighborhoods, or a quiet coffee on an outdoor patio, would be a splendid way to soak in the day's offerings as the vibrant city stirs to life.
